title: Bad error message when concatting different type Tensor(Variable)
body_html:
import torch
x = torch.randn(3,4)
y = torch.randn(3,4).double()
z = torch.cat([x,y], 0)

TypeError: cat received an invalid combination of arguments - got (list, int), but expected one of:

  • (sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq)
  • (sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq, int dim)
    didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (list, int)
x = torch.autograd.Variable(x)
y = torch.autograd.Variable(y)
z = torch.cat([x,y], 0)

TypeError: cat received an invalid combination of arguments - got (tuple, int), but expected one of:

  • (sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq)
  • (sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq, int dim)
    didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (tuple, int)

The error message is providing nothing, even misleading information.

Found other error messages when trying to do computation on two different type tensors are also bad.
body_text:
import torch
x = torch.randn(3,4)
y = torch.randn(3,4).double()
z = torch.cat([x,y], 0)


TypeError: cat received an invalid combination of arguments - got (list, int), but expected one of:

(sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq)
(sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq, int dim)
didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (list, int)


x = torch.autograd.Variable(x)
y = torch.autograd.Variable(y)
z = torch.cat([x,y], 0)


TypeError: cat received an invalid combination of arguments - got (tuple, int), but expected one of:

(sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq)
(sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq, int dim)
didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (tuple, int)


The error message is providing nothing, even misleading information.
Found other error messages when trying to do computation on two different type tensors are also bad.
body:
```
import torch
x = torch.randn(3,4)
y = torch.randn(3,4).double()
z = torch.cat([x,y], 0)
```

> TypeError: cat received an invalid combination of arguments - got (list, int), but expected one of:
>  * (sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq)
>  * (sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq, int dim)
>       didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (list, int)

```
x = torch.autograd.Variable(x)
y = torch.autograd.Variable(y)
z = torch.cat([x,y], 0)
```
> TypeError: cat received an invalid combination of arguments - got (tuple, int), but expected one of:
>  * (sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq)
>  * (sequence[torch.FloatTensor] seq, int dim)
>       didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (tuple, int)


The error message is providing nothing, even misleading information.



Found other error messages when trying to do computation on two different type tensors are also bad.
